Kompolnas Desak Propam Periksa Polantas Pukul Sopir Ambulans di Sumut
04 Nov 2019, 09:15 by Audrey Santoso
Tebing Tinggi - Komisi Kepolisian Nasional (Kompolnas) mendesak Propam memeriksa oknum polisi lalu lintas yang diduga memukul sopir ambulans di Tebing Tinggi, Sumatera Utara (Sumut). Menurut Kompolnas, oknum polisi itu harus diberi hukuman agar jera dan jadi pelajaran bagi anggota Polri.
"Saya mendesak Propam untuk memeriksa yang bersangkutan. Perkara itu tidak cukup diselesaikan dengan cara damai. Kasus ini harus jadi pelajaran dan hukuman akan jadi efek jera untuk yang bersangkutan dan seluruh anggota Polri," kata anggota Kompolnas Poengky Indarti kepada wartawan, Senin (4/11/2019).
Dia menilai tak masuk akal seorang Polantas tidak mendahulukan ambulans. Menurutnya, kalau jalan macet maka ambulans itu harus dibantu agar bisa berjalan dengan cepat.
"Pimpinan harus tetap memproses etik yang bersangkutan. Sangat tidak masuk akal seorang polisi lalu lintas tidak memahami Undang-undang Lalu Lintas bahwa ambulans justru harus didahulukan dan jika jalan macet harus dibantu supaya ambulans berjalan lancar dan cepat menuju rumah sakit," ujarnya.
"Bukan mengadang dan marah-marah mendengar bunyi ambulans," sambung Poengky.
Sebelumnya, seorang oknum polisi di Tebing Tinggi, Sumut, Brigadir UMP, terlibak cekcok dan tampak memukul sopir ambulans yang sedang membawa pasien. Kedua belah pihak disebut sudah saling memaafkan dan sepakat berdamai, namun Kapolres Tebing Tinggi AKBP Sunadi mengatakan Brigadir UMP tetap menjalani proses sidang disiplin untuk mempertanggungjawabkan sikapnya. Brigadir UMP sendiri telah dinonaktifkan dari tugas.

Kompolnas Urges Propam to Check Traffic Police Ambulance at North Sumatra Drivers
Nov 04 2019, 09:15 by Audrey Santoso
Tebing Tinggi - National Police Commission (Kompolnas) urges Propam to check the traffic police who allegedly hit an ambulance driver in Tebing Tinggi, North Sumatra (North Sumatra). According to the National Police Commission, the police must be given punishment so that they become a deterrent and become a lesson for Polri members.
"I urge Propam to examine the person concerned. The case was not enough to be resolved by peaceful means. This case must be a lesson and the punishment will be a deterrent effect for those concerned and all members of the National Police," Kompolnas member Poengky Indarti told reporters on Monday (4 / 11/2019).
He thought it was unreasonable for a Traffic Police not to prioritize an ambulance. According to him, if the road is congested, the ambulance must be helped so that it can run quickly.
"The leadership must continue to process the ethics in question. It is very unreasonable for a traffic police officer not to understand the Traffic Law that the ambulance must take precedence and if a traffic jam must be helped so that the ambulance runs smoothly and quickly to the hospital," he said.
"Not blocking and getting angry at the sound of an ambulance," continued Poengky.
Previously, a police officer in Tebing Tinggi, North Sumatra, UMP Brigadier, was caught in a brawl and appeared to hit an ambulance driver carrying a patient. Both parties are said to have forgiven each other and agreed to make peace, but Tebing Tinggi Police Chief Adjunct Senior Commissioner Sunadi said the UMP Brigadier continued to undergo a disciplinary hearing process to account for his attitude. The UMP Brigadier himself has been deactivated from duty.
